maintains a clean and safe vehicle.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Performs pre- and post-trip inspections of assigned vehicle using utilizing standard DVIR (Driver Vehicle Inspection Report); notes all issues on DVIR form for corrective review\u002Frepair.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Immediately reports any unsafe situations or service calls to Route Manager or Dispatch before attempting service.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Participates and cooperates in all scheduled training, briefings, and meetings as required by Route Manager.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Works closely with Route Managers to improve route efficiencies and identify problem or unsafe accounts.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Performs all duties as scheduled by Route Manager or Dispatch, assisting other company drivers as directed.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Notifies Route Manager of any incidents, accidents, injures, or property damage.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Notifies Dispatch or Route Manager of issues as prescribed by Service Machine protocol, including blocked containers, potential missed pick-ups or problems that arise on the route.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Communicates customer requests or issues to Dispatch or Route Manager.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Completely dumps all containers and leaves the customer’s location clean and free of debris. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Completes and submits customer tickets when excess yardage must be removed.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Positions containers on the customer’s property in a manner that ensures lids are properly replaced, containers are set in an upright position, and containers do not block driveway entrances or traffic.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Follows route assignments throughout the day and completes all documentation when checking-in at the end of the route.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>III. Exigences en matière de santé et de sécurité au travail (SST) et DOT (ministère des Transports) ainsi que toutes les lois municipales, provinciales et fédérales.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Effectuer des inspections avant et après le voyage de l'équipement attribué et vérifie les documents sur le DVIR standard (Driver Vehicle Inspection Report.).<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Signaler immédiatement les situations dangereuses ou les problèmes liés au service au superviseur de route ou au Dispatch.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Participer à tous les programmes de formation, breffages et réunions programmés requis par Waste Management.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les gestionnaires de routes pour améliorer l'efficacité des routes et identifier les meilleures pratiques.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Aviser le superviseur de route de tout incident, accident, blessure ou dommage matériel.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Identifier et signaler tous les conteneurs nécessitant une réparation ou un remplacement<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Suivre les affectations d'itinéraire comme indiqué et complète la documentation de fin de journée et le processus de vérification.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>Qualifications \n <p>Les exigences énumérées ci-dessous sont représentatives des qualifications nécessaires pour effectuer le travail:<\u002Fp> \n <p>A. Éducation et expérience<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Expérience: 1 an d'expérience de travail pertinente dans la conduite d'un véhicule nécessitant un permis de classe 3 ou supérieur<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>B. Job Summary<\u002Fb><br> Safely operates a heavy-duty truck to perform assigned duties on transfer routes. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>II. Essential Duties and Responsibilities<\u002Fb><br> To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Other minor duties may be assigned. <\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Operates vehicle in accordance with Occupational Health &amp; Safety and Ministry of Transportation (MTO) requirements as well as all local, provincial, and federal requirements and Company expectations for the Fleet; maintains a clean and safe vehicle.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Performs pre- and post-trip inspections of assigned vehicle using utilizing standard DVIR (Driver Vehicle Inspection Report); notes all issues on DVIR form for corrective review\u002Frepair.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Immediately reports any unsafe situations or service calls to Route Manager or Dispatch before attempting service.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Participates and cooperates in all scheduled training, briefings, and meetings as required by Route Manager.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Works closely with Route Managers to improve route efficiencies and identify problem or unsafe accounts.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Performs all duties as scheduled by Route Manager or Dispatch, assisting other company drivers as directed.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Notifies Route Manager of any incidents, accidents, injures, or property damage.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Notifies Dispatch or Route Manager of issues as prescribed by Service Machine protocol, including blocked containers, potential missed pick-ups or problems that arise on the route.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Communicates customer requests or issues to Dispatch or Route Manager.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Completely dumps all containers and leaves the customer’s location clean and free of debris. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Completes and submits customer tickets when excess yardage must be removed.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Positions containers on the customer’s property in a manner that ensures lids are properly replaced, containers are set in an upright position, and containers do not block driveway entrances or traffic.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Follows route assignments throughout the day and completes all documentation when checking-in at the end of the route.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>III. without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, or veteran status.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Rate:<\u002Fb> $29.38<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Shift: <\u002Fb>Mon, Wed, Thurs &amp; Fri \u002F 6:00am - 4:30pm<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>I. Job Summary<\u002Fb><br> Safely operates a heavy-duty truck to perform assigned duties on transfer routes. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>II. Essential Duties and Responsibilities<\u002Fb><br> To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Other minor duties may be assigned. <\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Operates vehicle in accordance with Occupational Health and Safety Standards and Ministry of Transportation (MTO) requirements as well as all local, provincial and federal requirements and Company expectations for the Fleet; maintains a clean and safe vehicle.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Performs pre- and post-trip inspections of assigned vehicle using utilizing standard DVIR (Driver Vehicle Inspection Report); notes all issues on DVIR form for corrective review\u002Frepair.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Immediately reports any unsafe situations or service calls to Route Manager or Dispatch before attempting service.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Participates and cooperates in all scheduled training, briefings, and meetings as required by Route Manager.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Works closely with Route Managers to improve route efficiencies and identify problem or unsafe accounts.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Performs all duties as scheduled by Route Manager or Dispatch, assisting other company drivers as directed.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Notifies Route Manager of any incidents, accidents, injures, or property damage.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Notifies Dispatch or Route Manager of issues as prescribed by Service Machine protocol, including blocked containers, potential missed pick-ups or problems that arise on the route.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Communicates customer requests or issues to Dispatch or Route Manager.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Completely dumps all containers and leaves the customer’s location clean and free of debris. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Completes and submits customer tickets when excess yardage must be removed.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Minor lifting required on occasion (25-50 kgs).<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Positions containers on the customer’s property in a manner that ensures lids are properly replaced, containers are set in an upright position, and containers do not block driveway entrances or traffic.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Follows route assignments throughout the day and completes all documentation when checking-in at the end of the route.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>III. Supervisory Responsibilities<\u002Fb><br> This job has no supervisory duties.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>IV. Qualifications<\u002Fb><br> The requirements listed below are representative of the qualifications necessary to perform the job.<\u002Fp> \n <p>A. Education and Experience<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Education: None required. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Experience: No prior work experience required.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p>B. <p><b>We're Looking for G to D Apprentice Drivers in Mount Forest!<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>As an EEO\u002FAffirmative Action Employer, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, or veteran status.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Rate: <\u002Fb>$21.50<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Shift: <\u002Fb>M - F 6:00am - 5:00pm<\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <p><b>DRIVER APPRENTICE – G TO D PROGRAM<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <p>At Waste Management, we know that it can be challenging to obtain your Commercial Driver’s License! We recognize the time commitment and the costs associated with schooling to get your D license! That’s why WM developed a program for <b>Apprentice Drivers! <\u002Fb>This program will take you from a <b>G to a D<\u002Fb> license - providing you with the training, work experience as well as reimbursing you for your Driver School Tuition. Everything you need to grow into a successful and skilled Commercial Driver!<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n  <p><br> <b>THE JOB<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <p>In tandem with a seasoned WM Driver and\u002For WM Driver Trainer, after receiving their Commercial Driving Permit, the <b>Driver Apprentice<\u002Fb> will complete the required training to safely operate a commercial motor vehicle providing service to customers in their respective Line of Business (LOB). The Driver Apprentice will continue in this role until they complete all training requirements.<\u002Fp> \n  <p><b>WHAT DO I NEED TO BE CONSIDERED?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Must be at least 18 years of age.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Valid Driver’s License<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Registration within 3 months of initial hire with a recognized local driving school to obtain DZ license.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Completion of DZ Driver Training within 12 months of initial hire date.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Legally eligible to work in Canada with a valid S.I.N<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to perform physical requirements of the position with or without reasonable accommodations.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Successfully complete pre-employment drug screen and medical<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b>WHAT YOU’LL GET IN THE PROGRAM:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Waste Management will cover the cost of the driving course from a recognized driving school to a maximum of $2600.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><b>THE DAY-TO-DAY<\u002Fb> <b>While in training, the following skills will be taught, and the trainee must be able to demonstrate proficiency prior to moving to the next driver level:<\u002Fb> <\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Performs as an on-route Helper while obtaining their Commercial Driving Permit and completing the training to be a WM Driver.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>After obtaining their Commercial Driving Permit, partners with a WM Driver and\u002For WM Driver Trainer to train on the proper way to operate a commercial refuse \u002F recycling vehicle. \n    <ul>\n     <li>Operates vehicle in accordance with Waste Management Safety and Life Critical Rules, Occupational and Safety Health and Ministry of Transportation requirements as well as all local, state and federal laws.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Performs pre- and post-trip inspections of assigned vehicle and documents checks utilizing the standard DVIR (Driver Vehicle Inspection Report).<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Immediately reports all unsafe situations or service-related issues to Route Manager or Dispatch.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Attends and participates in all scheduled training programs, briefings, and meetings as required by Waste Management or directed by the Route Manager.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Works closely with Route Manager to improve route efficiencies and identify best practices.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Notifies Route Manager of any incidents, accidents, injures, or property damage.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Notifies Route Manager or Dispatch of service interruptions including closed or impassable streets or alleyways, receptacles too heavy to service or potential safety hazards.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Communicates customer requests to Dispatch or Route Manager.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Completely dumps all receptacles and leaves the customer’s location clean and free of debris. <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Follows route assignments as directed and completes end of day documentation and check out process.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Performs all duties as scheduled by Route Manager or Dispatch and assisting other drivers as directed to meet customer needs.<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n Essential Duties and Responsibilities<\u002Fb><br> To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Other minor duties may be assigned. <\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Works under limited supervision and selects from written instructions and established procedures to accomplish assigned tasks. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Performs repairs and assigned preventive maintenance services.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Performs inspection, diagnosis and repair of electrical, hydraulic, suspension, brake and air systems on vehicles and equipment.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Utilizes vehicle computer electronics systems to interpret failure modes to initiate or assign repairs.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Estimates time and material costs on vehicle repairs and requisitions new parts.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Performs all work within Standard Repair Times (SRTs).<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Performs service calls for emergency breakdowns.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Conducts safety checks on vehicles.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Completes required paperwork utilizing fleet maintenance software program associated with repairing vehicles, documenting parts usage, and accounting for repair times.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Assists senior Mechanics in the completion of project work.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Reviews, completes or assigns repairs identified on Driver Vehicle Inspection Reports.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Maintains a clean, safe work area in compliance with Corporate \u002F OSHA Standards, and performs all work in accordance with established safety procedures.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>III. Job Summary<\u002Fb><br> Under general supervision, performs preventive maintenance services and inspects, diagnoses and repairs vehicles and equipment.<br> <br> <b>II. Essential Duties and Responsibilities<\u002Fb><br> To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Other minor duties may be assigned. <\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Works under limited supervision and selects from written instructions and established procedures to accomplish assigned tasks. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Performs repairs and assigned preventive maintenance services.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Performs inspection, diagnosis and repair of electrical, hydraulic, suspension, brake and air systems on vehicles and equipment.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Utilizes vehicle computer electronics systems to interpret failure modes to initiate or assign repairs.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Estimates time and material costs on vehicle repairs and requisitions new parts.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Performs all work within Standard Repair Times (SRTs).<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Performs service calls for emergency breakdowns.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Conducts safety checks on vehicles.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Completes required paperwork utilizing fleet maintenance software program associated with repairing vehicles, documenting parts usage, and accounting for repair times.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Assists senior Mechanics in the completion of project work.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Reviews, completes or assigns repairs identified on Driver Vehicle Inspection Reports.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Maintains a clean, safe work area in compliance with Corporate \u002F OSHA Standards, and performs all work in accordance with established safety procedures.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>III. Supervisory Responsibilities<\u002Fb><br> This job has no supervisory duties.<br> <br> <b>IV. Qualifications<\u002Fb><br> The requirements listed below are representative of the qualifications necessary to perform the job.<br> <br> A. Education and Experience<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Education: Not required.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience: Three to Four (3-4) years of relevant work experience.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p>B. Certificates, Licenses, Registrations or Other Requirements<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Valid driver’s license and must have a clean driving record.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Must be at least 18 years of age.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Legally eligible to work in Canada.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to perform physical requirements of the position with or without reasonable accommodations.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Successfully complete and pass pre-employment drug screen and physical.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p>C. Other Knowledge, Skills or Abilities Required<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>None required.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>V. Work Environment<\u002Fb><br> Listed below are key points regarding environmental demands and work environment of the job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the job.<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Required to use motor coordination with finger dexterity (such as keyboarding, machine operation, etc.) most of the work day;<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Required to exert physical effort in handling objects less than __ pounds most of the work day;<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Required to be exposed to physical occupational risks (such as cuts, burns, exposure to toxic chemicals, etc.) often;<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Required to be exposed to physical environment which involves dirt, odors, noise, weather extremes or similar elements often;<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p>Normal setting for this job is: repair\u002Fmaintenance shop.<br> <br> <b>Benefits<\u002Fb><br> At Waste Management, each eligible employee receives a competitive total compensation package including Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance and Short Term Disability. age, national origin, disability, or veteran status.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>I. Job Summary<\u002Fb><br> The Collection Operations Management Trainee (OMT) training program is designed to develop individuals into frontline manager roles. The OMT program duration is 6 - 9 months, at the end of which successful candidates must be willing to relocate within an assigned geographic area. This position requires extensive travel through assigned work activities and projects. Successful candidates will develop a working knowledge of the WM day-to-day collection operations including but not limited to route analysis, safety rules and practices, and the function and role of intra-company departments as it pertains to day to day business and long term goals (HR, Finance\u002FAccounting, Customer Experience, Fleet, Dispatch).<br> <br> <b>II. <p>As an EEO\u002FAffirmative Action Employer, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, or veteran status.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Waste Management (WM), a Fortune 250 company, is the leading provider of comprehensive waste and environmental services in North America. We are strongly committed to a foundation of operating excellence, professionalism and financial strength. WM serves nearly 25 million customers in residential, commercial, industrial and municipal markets throughout North America through a network of collection operations, transfer stations, landfills, recycling facilities and waste-based energy production projects.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>I. Job Summary<\u002Fb><br> The Account Associate I – Bilingual (IAM - TEAM) generates shareholder value by using a consultative retention based selling approach for Small\u002FMedium commercial Waste Management customers as part of a team-based queue. The IAM - TEAM manages existing business relationships focused on achieving budgeted retention goals by developing and implementing sound retention strategies, utilizing strong negotiation efforts to preserve business, and securing and updating contract agreements from WM customers as well as growing revenues from existing customers. The role of the IAM - TEAM is to maintain a net positive business performance in the commercial space through proactive outreach, account retention and revenue protection efforts to maintain a mutually beneficial alignment between the customer and WM’s growth goals. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>II. Essential Duties and Responsibilities<\u002Fb><br> To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Other minor duties may be assigned. <\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Customer interaction (external and internal), response &amp; follow up.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Serves as the lead point of contact for customer account management matters as part of a team-based queue, establish and maintain a high level of customer satisfaction with internal and external customers, and build and maintain strong, long-lasting customer relationships.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Aligns Waste Management products and services with customer needs, propose solutions that are compliant with appropriate local, state and federal regulations, and increase account penetration through consultative selling skills.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Negotiates, updates, and renews customer service agreements to maximize profits by providing ongoing education of contract details and use of strong negotiation skills.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Resolves challenging customer requests and collaborate with the Inside Sales Manager to resolve all customer escalations or issues.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Communicate rates, charges and service strategies with conviction as well as understand and effectively use customer incentives and concessions within appropriate profit targets and level of authority.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Collaborates with sales team to identify and grow opportunities within territory and engage additional WM business opportunities, referring internally as appropriate.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Administrative work.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Use Waste Management sales productivity software tools accurately and consistently (i.e. Salesforce.com\u002FCustomer Relationship Management and Pricing Tools).<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Prepares reports as needed and\u002For handle general administrative duties as appropriate.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>III. Supervisory Responsibilities<\u002Fb><br> This position has no supervisory responsibilities.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>IV. Qualifications<\u002Fb><br> The requirements listed below are representative of the qualifications necessary to perform the job.<br> <br> A. Education and Experience<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Education: High School Diploma or GED (accredited).<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience: One (1) year of business-to-business account management experience at a proficient level (in addition to education requirement).<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p>B. Certificates, Licenses, Registrations or Other Requirements<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>None required. <\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p>C. Other Knowledge, Skills or Abilities Required<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Ability to speak fluent conversational French and English.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to effectively convert customer cancellation requests into long term relationships.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to effectively build relationships across a wide variety of business types.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to multi-task and perform computer duties across multiple screens while on phone with customers addressing issues or concerns in a professional tone and temperament.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proficient in time management and in computer skills – Word, Excel, Power Point, etc. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Positive attitude that enjoys assisting and providing solutions to others.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>High impact communication in written and verbal manner.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to adapt to change and manage multiple priorities.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to negotiate effectively.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to utilize sound business practices.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to work independently and as part of a team.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>V. Work Environment<\u002Fb><br> Listed below are key points regarding environmental demands and work environment of the job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the job.<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Required to use motor coordination with finger dexterity (such as keyboarding, machine operation, etc.) most of the workday;<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Required to exert physical effort in handling objects less than 30 pounds rarely;<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Normal setting for this job is an office setting.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Benefits<\u002Fb><br> At Waste Management, each eligible employee receives a competitive total compensation package including Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance and Short Term Disability. As well as a Stock Purchase Plan, Company match on 401K, and more! Our employees also receive Paid Vacation, Holidays, and Personal Days. \n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b>DRIVER APPRENTICE – G TO D PROGRAM<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <p>At Waste Management, we know that it can be challenging to obtain your Commercial Driver’s License! We recognize the time commitment and the costs associated with schooling to get your D license! That’s why WM developed a program for <b>Apprentice Drivers! <\u002Fb>This program will take you from a <b>G to a D<\u002Fb> license - providing you with the training, work experience as well as reimbursing you for your Driver School Tuition. Everything you need to grow into a successful and skilled Commercial Driver!<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n  <p><br> <b>THE JOB<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <p>In tandem with a seasoned WM Driver and\u002For WM Driver Trainer, after receiving their Commercial Driving Permit, the <b>Driver Apprentice<\u002Fb> will complete the required training to safely operate a commercial motor vehicle providing service to customers in their respective Line of Business (LOB). The Driver Apprentice will continue in this role until they complete all training requirements.<\u002Fp> \n  <b>WHAT DO I NEED TO BE CONSIDERED?<\u002Fb> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Must be at least 18 years of age.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Valid Driver’s License<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Registration within 3 months of initial hire with a recognized local driving school to obtain DZ license.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Completion of DZ Driver Training within 12 months of initial hire date.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Legally eligible to work in Canada with a valid S.I.N<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to perform physical requirements of the position with or without reasonable accommodations.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Successfully complete pre-employment drug screen and medical<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b>WHAT YOU’LL GET IN THE PROGRAM:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Waste Management will cover the cost of the driving course from a recognized driving school to a maximum of $2600.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful>\n  <b>THE DAY-TO-DAY<\u002Fb> \n  <b>While in training, the following skills will be taught, and the trainee must be able to demonstrate proficiency prior to moving to the next driver level:<\u002Fb> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Performs as an on-route Helper while obtaining their Commercial Driving Permit and completing the training to be a WM Driver.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>After obtaining their Commercial Driving Permit, partners with a WM Driver and\u002For WM Driver Trainer to train on the proper way to operate a commercial refuse \u002F recycling vehicle. \n    <ul>\n     <li>Operates vehicle in accordance with Waste Management Safety and Life Critical Rules, Occupational and Safety Health and Ministry of Transportation requirements as well as all local, state and federal laws.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Performs pre- and post-trip inspections of assigned vehicle and documents checks utilizing the standard DVIR (Driver Vehicle Inspection Report).<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Immediately reports all unsafe situations or service-related issues to Route Manager or Dispatch.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Attends and participates in all scheduled training programs, briefings, and meetings as required by Waste Management or directed by the Route Manager.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Works closely with Route Manager to improve route efficiencies and identify best practices.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Notifies Route Manager of any incidents, accidents, injures, or property damage.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Notifies Route Manager or Dispatch of service interruptions including closed or impassable streets or alleyways, receptacles too heavy to service or potential safety hazards.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Communicates customer requests to Dispatch or Route Manager.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Completely dumps all receptacles and leaves the customer’s location clean and free of debris. <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Follows route assignments as directed and completes end of day documentation and check out process.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Performs all duties as scheduled by Route Manager or Dispatch and assisting other drivers as directed to meet customer needs.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful><br> <\u002Fli>\n <p>As an EEO\u002FAffirmative Action Employer, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, or veteran status.<\u002Fp> \n <p>If you are someone who digs accounting and data; processing, auditing, reviewing, reconciling, looking for oddities, learning new systems, finding better ways to do things and (in a nutshell) you don’t miss a beat - then this role is for you! <\u002Fp>\n <p>Reporting to our Area Controller, you will be joining a core team responsible for providing accounting support to Sites and Management and reporting to business partners throughout our Canada Area on financial results. You will be working closely with Operations, Site Managers, the Finance Team and other stakeholders to obtain and verify information for the monthly close process, as well as working with many of the same people to assure proper supporting documents and reconciliations throughout the month. This opportunity offers a variety of activities, diversity and opportunities for creativity and personal growth.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Location: This is a Hybrid role. Office days are currently Tuesday,Wednesday &amp; Thursdays (from either the Kitchener, Stoney Creek or Brampton office)<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Why WM?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>This role is entitled to a competitive base salary, an attractive bonus package and excellent options for self-directed benefits coverage. As a WM employee, you are eligible for our employee-discounted stock purchase price, participation in our contribution\u002Fmatching RRSP program (that’s like free money) and lots of online training via our own online WM University!<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>What You’ve Got:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Bachelor’s Degree and three to five years of relevant work experience (accounting, cost accounting, analyst)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>CPA designation preferred. Currently in last stages of working towards your designation <i>with<\u002Fi> additional work experience may be considered.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong interpersonal and relationship-building skills; high organization, self-direction and independence.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>You’re Good At:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Solving problems. You love taking on challenges and finding creative solutions. If you don’t know the answer, you’ll use your resources to dig until you find it.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Communicating clearly, both written and verbally. You can explain just about anything to anyone and you don’t get flustered easily. You enjoy working with people from many different fields.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Excel: this is definitely a must-have! We use a lot of other computer systems, too – so you’ll need to be an enthusiastic learner and open to changing tools and processes.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Manipulating various data and files to produce reports and analyzing results.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Motivating yourself; you’re a self-starter and take pride in achieving goals. You are driven and want to become a subject-matter-expert, to care for your sites.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Managing multiple time-sensitive tasks to completion, engaging external and internal business partners for input when needed.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Looking for better ways to do things – seeking efficiencies, suggesting other options, questioning the status quo.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>A High-Level Look at the Day-to-Day:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Partner with operations your sites to ensure accuracy of purchases, payables and overall results <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Create, review and analyze month-end results for your sites, and follow-up on issues and questions during close period. This includes posting of journal entries, running and review of reports from multiple systems and preparation of financial statements <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Ensure accruals are complete and timely<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Lead and\u002For participate in monthly financial meetings with other finance partners, operations and site managers <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Partner with site operations and management to ensure gatehouse policies are known at site, are being maintained, and that reporting is correct <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Work with DMs, management, operations and fleet generally, to ensure proper procedures are being followed and information is being communicated correctly in a timely manner<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Compare transfer and MRF volume IB and OB and balance monthly<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Review fuel, parts, tires costs and communicate with sites<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Review disposal costs and investigate\u002Fanalyze significant changes<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Prepare and distribute summary reporting files for Finance team and Area leadership<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Reconcile relevant balance sheet GL accounts monthly, including researching and solving issues<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Maintain and reconcile Fixed Asset subledgers with annual counts and confirmations<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Assist with confirmation of and\u002For analyze bi-annual vehicle parts counts performed by sites<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Stay updated on policy changes and partner with team to communicate same to Operations as needed<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Assist in the preparation of working papers for annual audit or biannual internal audits<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Prepare ad hoc reporting, analysis and investigation as needed across multiple platforms<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Above list is not exhaustive, duties and responsibilities may change and occasional travel to sites is required<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Next Steps<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Go ahead and take a moment to complete your application. Don’t forget to include a resume so we can see all the experience and accomplishments you have under your belt. If we like what we see, we will invite you to complete a pre-screening video interview, so be prepared to show off your skills!<\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <b>Benefits<\u002Fb>\n  <br> At Waste Management, each eligible employee receives a competitive total compensation package including Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance and Short Term Disability. As well as a Stock Purchase Plan, Company match on RRSP, and more! Our employees also receive Paid Vacation, Holidays, and Personal Days. Please note that benefits may vary by site. \n <\u002Fdiv> \n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <p>If this sounds like the opportunity that you have been looking for, please click \"Apply\"<\u002Fp> \n Essential Duties and Responsibilities<\u002Fb><br> To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Other minor duties may be assigned. <\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Works under limited supervision and selects from written instructions and established procedures to accomplish assigned tasks. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Performs repairs and assigned preventive maintenance services.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Performs inspection, diagnosis and repair of electrical, hydraulic, suspension, brake and air systems on vehicles and equipment.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Utilizes vehicle computer electronics systems to interpret failure modes to initiate or assign repairs.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Estimates time and material costs on vehicle repairs and requisitions new parts.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Performs all work within Standard Repair Times (SRTs).<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Performs service calls for emergency breakdowns.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Conducts safety checks on vehicles.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Completes required paperwork utilizing fleet maintenance software program associated with repairing vehicles, documenting parts usage, and accounting for repair times.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Assists senior Mechanics in the completion of project work.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Reviews, completes or assigns repairs identified on Driver Vehicle Inspection Reports.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Maintains a clean, safe work area in compliance with Corporate \u002F OSHA Standards, and performs all work in accordance with established safety procedures.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>III. maintains a clean and safe vehicle.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Performs pre- and post-trip inspections of assigned vehicle using utilizing standard DVIR (Driver Vehicle Inspection Report); notes all issues on DVIR form for corrective review\u002Frepair.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Immediately reports any unsafe situations or service calls to Route Manager or Dispatch before attempting service.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Participates and cooperates in all scheduled training, briefings, and meetings as required by Route Manager.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Works closely with Route Managers to improve route efficiencies and identify problem or unsafe accounts.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Performs all duties as scheduled by Route Manager or Dispatch, assisting other company drivers as directed.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Notifies Route Manager of any incidents, accidents, injures, or property damage.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Notifies Dispatch or Route Manager of issues as prescribed by Service Machine protocol, including blocked containers, potential missed pick-ups or problems that arise on the route.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Communicates customer requests or issues to Dispatch or Route Manager.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Completely dumps all containers and leaves the customer’s location clean and free of debris. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Completes and submits customer tickets when excess yardage must be removed.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Positions containers on the customer’s property in a manner that ensures lids are properly replaced, containers are set in an upright position, and containers do not block driveway entrances or traffic.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Follows route assignments throughout the day and completes all documentation when checking-in at the end of the route.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>III. <p>Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><i>Ready to roll with us? <\u002Fi>Click Apply to join the Waste Management team today.<br> <br> <b>I. Job Summary<\u002Fb><br> Manage the Landfill Gas to Energy Facility to maximize production, while ensuring safe work practices, environmental compliance, timely maintenance, compliance with contracts, and coordination with the landfill management and operations.<br> <br> <b>II. Essential Duties and Responsibilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Other minor duties may be assigned. <\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Implements WM and WMRE safety policies and practices for all work activities, and ensures these practices are followed by other WM staff, vendors, contractors, and visitors.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Complies with all operational requirements of the air permit, which may include CYCLE task tracking, documentation of compliance with standard operating procedures, performing emissions tests, and adjusting equipment to meet emissions limits. Represents WMRE during third party testing and regulatory inspections.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Coordinates all scheduled plant maintenance, unscheduled down time, compliance, and well-field issues and regularly communicates this with the Market Area Gas Operations Manager (MAGOM) and\u002For WMRE Operations Manager.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Repairs, maintains, and services all equipment in accordance with the facility Standard Operating Procedures, equipment maintenance manuals, and WMRE policies and training.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Evaluates equipment operational data and determines proper course of action to maximize production and reduce expense without impairing equipment. Reports reoccurring shutdowns or equipment de-rating to WMRE operations managers for analysis, and participates in corrective actions.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Promptly responds to call-outs of plant shutdowns during non-business hours to identify the cause of the shutdown and perform repairs or adjustments to return the plant to operation.. Consults with WMRE operations managers as needed.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Identifies backup staff in coordination with the WMRE regional manager, and assigns call-out schedules to ensure that there is at least one plant manager available 24\u002F7\u002F365 for plant shutdowns and emergencies. For self and backup, adjusts daily or weekly on-site presence at plant during business hours to reflect time spent for call-outs, with consideration that all other daily and monthly duties must be completed on a timely basis.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Procures plant supplies and replacement equipment in an efficient manner by identifying needs in advance, managing vendors, and working within WMRE guidelines.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Maintains the facility spare inventory and provides a written inventory count twice annually.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Complies with power purchase agreements, gas sales agreements, interconnect agreements, or other contracts. Represents WMRE as the first point of contact with the power\u002Fgas purchaser with respect to facility operations, and complies with all power\u002Fgas scheduling requirements as directed by the purchaser.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Assists the MAGOM, landfill gas technician, and landfill District Manager as a first priority in emergencies and as allowed by workload for routine or repetitive tasks.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Schedules and conducts plant tours as requested to support good community relations. Represent WMRE as the on-site technical expert on production of renewable energy from landfill gas.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Complete special assignments\u002Ftasks as required by WMRE Operations Manager, Market Area Gas Operations Manager, or Landfill District Manager.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>III. Supervisory Responsibilities<\u002Fb><br> No supervisory responsibilities required.<br> <br> <b>IV. Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>A. Education and Experience<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Education: High School Diploma or G.E.D (accredited).<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience: 5 years of relevant work experience diagnosing and repairing internal combustion engines and cooling systems (in addition to education requirement).<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p>B. Certificates, Licenses, Registrations or Other Requirements<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Must have valid driver’s license<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p>C. Other Knowledge, Skills or Abilities Required<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Fundamental knowledge of computer data entry and interpretation<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Basic knowledge of 120\u002F240\u002F480 3ph volt AC circuits.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Understand concepts of 4160 volt circuits<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Must be able to lift a minimum of 100 lbs.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Must be able to travel up to 15% with overnight stays.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Must be able to diagnose and repair DC circuits 12\u002F24 volts.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Must be familiar with basic principles of building maintenance.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>V. Work Environment<\u002Fb><br> Listed below are key points regarding environmental demands and work environment of the job. <p>Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><i>Ready to roll with us? <\u002Fi>Click Apply to join the Waste Management team today.<br> <br> <b>I. Job Summary<\u002Fb><br> Manage the Landfill Gas to Energy Facility to maximize production, while ensuring safe work practices, environmental compliance, timely maintenance, compliance with contracts, and coordination with the landfill management and operations.<br> <br> <b>II. Essential Duties and Responsibilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Other minor duties may be assigned. <\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Implements WM and WMRE safety policies and practices for all work activities, and ensures these practices are followed by other WM staff, vendors, contractors, and visitors.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Complies with all operational requirements of the air permit, which may include CYCLE task tracking, documentation of compliance with standard operating procedures, performing emissions tests, and adjusting equipment to meet emissions limits. Represents WMRE during third party testing and regulatory inspections.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Coordinates all scheduled plant maintenance, unscheduled down time, compliance, and well-field issues and regularly communicates this with the Market Area Gas Operations Manager (MAGOM) and\u002For WMRE Operations Manager.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Repairs, maintains, and services all equipment in accordance with the facility Standard Operating Procedures, equipment maintenance manuals, and WMRE policies and training.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Evaluates equipment operational data and determines proper course of action to maximize production and reduce expense without impairing equipment. Reports reoccurring shutdowns or equipment de-rating to WMRE operations managers for analysis, and participates in corrective actions.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Promptly responds to call-outs of plant shutdowns during non-business hours to identify the cause of the shutdown and perform repairs or adjustments to return the plant to operation.. Consults with WMRE operations managers as needed.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Identifies backup staff in coordination with the WMRE regional manager, and assigns call-out schedules to ensure that there is at least one plant manager available 24\u002F7\u002F365 for plant shutdowns and emergencies. For self and backup, adjusts daily or weekly on-site presence at plant during business hours to reflect time spent for call-outs, with consideration that all other daily and monthly duties must be completed on a timely basis.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Procures plant supplies and replacement equipment in an efficient manner by identifying needs in advance, managing vendors, and working within WMRE guidelines.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Maintains the facility spare inventory and provides a written inventory count twice annually.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Complies with power purchase agreements, gas sales agreements, interconnect agreements, or other contracts. Represents WMRE as the first point of contact with the power\u002Fgas purchaser with respect to facility operations, and complies with all power\u002Fgas scheduling requirements as directed by the purchaser.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Assists the MAGOM, landfill gas technician, and landfill District Manager as a first priority in emergencies and as allowed by workload for routine or repetitive tasks.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Schedules and conducts plant tours as requested to support good community relations. Represent WMRE as the on-site technical expert on production of renewable energy from landfill gas.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Complete special assignments\u002Ftasks as required by WMRE Operations Manager, Market Area Gas Operations Manager, or Landfill District Manager.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>III. Supervisory Responsibilities<\u002Fb><br> No supervisory responsibilities required.<br> <br> <b>IV. Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>A. Education and Experience<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Education: High School Diploma or G.E.D (accredited).<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience: 5 years of relevant work experience diagnosing and repairing internal combustion engines and cooling systems (in addition to education requirement).<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p>B. Certificates, Licenses, Registrations or Other Requirements<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Must have valid driver’s license<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p>C. Other Knowledge, Skills or Abilities Required<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Fundamental knowledge of computer data entry and interpretation<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Basic knowledge of 120\u002F240\u002F480 3ph volt AC circuits.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Understand concepts of 4160 volt circuits<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Must be able to lift a minimum of 100 lbs.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Must be able to travel up to 15% with overnight stays.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Must be able to diagnose and repair DC circuits 12\u002F24 volts.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Must be familiar with basic principles of building maintenance.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>V. Job Summary<\u002Fb><br> Oversees planning and execution of small and relatively simple projects. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>II. Other minor duties may be assigned. <\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Responsible for the management of construction and maintenance projects. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Planning and scheduling and organizing and directing site construction and maintenance. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Assisting with tender development and proposal evaluation, including interpretation and negotiation and administers and manages contractors and consultants. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Maintaining records including approvals and permits, as-built drawings and quality control records and project performance reports. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Creating and maintaining project schedule and document work progress. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Maintaining project budgets. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Upholding health and safety standards and company values. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Communicating with other managers and coordinating operational and maintenance and construction priorities. <\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>IV. Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>The requirements listed below are representative of the qualifications necessary to perform the job.<\u002Fp> \n <p>A. Education and Experience<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Education: Degree or diploma in construction or project management or engineering or demonstrated equivalency. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Experience: At least 3 years of construction or supervisory related experience with preference for civil construction experience. <\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p>B. Certificates, Licenses, Registrations or Other Requirements<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>None required.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p>C. age, national origin, disability, or veteran status.<br> <br> Tired of just doing preventative maintenance or working only on engines? We care about our Mechanic’s safety and show it by demanding solid safety practices of all our Mechanics and managers. Pride, safety, training, growth, opportunity, great benefits, rewards – check us out, we may be the company for you.<br> <br> <b>I. Job Summary<\u002Fb><br> Under general supervision, performs preventive maintenance services and inspects, diagnoses and repairs vehicles and equipment.<br> <br> <b>II. Essential Duties and Responsibilities<\u002Fb><br> To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Other minor duties may be assigned. <\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Works under limited supervision and selects from written instructions and established procedures to accomplish assigned tasks. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Performs repairs and assigned preventive maintenance services.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Performs inspection, diagnosis and repair of electrical, hydraulic, suspension, brake and air systems on vehicles and equipment.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Utilizes vehicle computer electronics systems to interpret failure modes to initiate or assign repairs.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Estimates time and material costs on vehicle repairs and requisitions new parts. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Performs all work within Standard Repair Times (SRTs). <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Performs service calls for emergency breakdowns. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Conducts safety checks on vehicles.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Completes required paperwork utilizing fleet maintenance software program associated with repairing vehicles, documenting parts usage, and accounting for repair times. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Assists senior Mechanics in the completion of project work. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Reviews, completes or assigns repairs identified on Driver Vehicle Inspection Reports. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Maintains a clean, safe work area in compliance with Corporate \u002F OSHA Standards, and performs all work in accordance with established safety procedures.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>III. Rate: $35.36 <\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <li><p>Sign On Bonus: $5,000.00 gross (paid out after 90 days and 180 days of employment) <\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li><p>Tool Allowance $850\u002Fyr <\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <li><p>$100 toward Truck &amp; Coach License renewal <\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <li><p>Uniform, coverall &amp; safety boots provided by the employer <\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <li><p>Pension: Up to 60% employer matching contribution (equates to $2.06\u002Fhr) <\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <li><p>Benefits: full benefits plan 100% paid by employer (equating to $2.15\u002Fhr) with buy-up option <\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>What do you need to apply? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Valid 310T Truck &amp; Coach Technician license. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Valid G class driver’s license and clean driving record. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Must be at least 18 years of age<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Legally eligible to work in Canada<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>I. Job Summary<\u002Fb><br> Under general supervision, performs preventive maintenance services and inspects, diagnoses and repairs vehicles and equipment.<\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>II. Essential Duties and Responsibilities<\u002Fb><br> To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Other minor duties may be assigned. <\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Works under limited supervision and selects from written instructions and established procedures to accomplish assigned tasks. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Performs repairs and assigned preventive maintenance services.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Performs inspection, diagnosis and repair of electrical, hydraulic, suspension, brake and air systems on vehicles and equipment.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Utilizes vehicle computer electronics systems to interpret failure modes to initiate or assign repairs.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Estimates time and material costs on vehicle repairs and requisitions new parts.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Performs all work within Standard Repair Times (SRTs).<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Performs service calls for emergency breakdowns.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Conducts safety checks on vehicles.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Completes required paperwork utilizing fleet maintenance software program associated with repairing vehicles, documenting parts usage, and accounting for repair times.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Assists senior Mechanics in the completion of project work.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Reviews, completes or assigns repairs identified on Driver Vehicle Inspection Reports.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Maintains a clean, safe work area in compliance with Corporate \u002F OSHA Standards, and performs all work in accordance with established safety procedures.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>III. Supervisory Responsibilities<\u002Fb><br> This job has no supervisory duties.<\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>What will you do? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p>Our technicians are trained to provide superior maintenance on both diesel equipment and, at some locations, on our growing fleet of CNG trucks. We care about our technician’s safety and show it by demanding solid safety practices of all our technicians and managers. activities within the assigned area, including cost control, employee development, and high training and safety standards. \n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n    Reviews capital equipment requisitions in line with Corporate guidelines and objectives. \n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n    Ensures safe and reliable vehicles are available to meet operational requirements. \n standards are met. \n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n    Ensures maintenance shops are adequately staffed and mechanics are properly trained. \n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n <p><i>Prêt à commencer votre avenir dès aujourd'hui ? <\u002Fi>Cliquez sur Postuler pour rejoindre l'équipe de Waste Management aujourd'hui.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Nous sommes présentement à la recherche d’un(e) Gestionnaire de comptes – Construction en télétravail #LI-REMOTE <\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <ul>\n   <li><b>Description du poste<\u002Fb><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p>Génère une croissance des revenus en utilisant une approche de vente consultative afin de fidéliser les clients actuels et futurs de Waste Management. Il est responsable de la gestion des relations commerciales pour atteindre les prévisions de ventes en élaborant et en mettant en œuvre des stratégies de développement solides, en utilisant des efforts de négociation importants pour maintenir les relations commerciales existantes et en obtenant des accords contractuels de la part de clients potentiels. Tous les cas d’escalade pour le service à la clientèle dans le territoire défini seront résolus par le titulaire de ce poste.<\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <ul>\n   <li><b>Les tâches et responsabilités essentielles<\u002Fb> sont les suivantes. Pour réussir dans cette fonction, une personne doit être en mesure d’accomplir chaque tâche essentielle de manière satisfaisante. D’autres fonctions mineures peuvent lui être confiées.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li>Gérer des relations commerciales entre entreprises.<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Élaborer des offres détaillées couvrant de multiples services.<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Faire des recherches sur certains aspects commerciaux des services de gestion des déchets et de l’environnement.<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Assister à des conférences\u002Fcolloques comme façon de réseauter et de se tenir au courant des informations relatives à l'industrie et au marché.<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Gérer les affectations.<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Établir des relations de confiance.<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Effectuer des communications à impact élevé.<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Être responsable de la prospection et de la clôture pour atteindre les prévisions de ventes en élaborant et en mettant en œuvre des stratégies de vente solides qui assurent la croissance des revenus.<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Gérer les clients potentiels en élaborant des plans de développement solides et en conservant les informations essentielles dans la base de données des clients- CRM.<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Faire correspondre les services de Waste Management aux besoins des clients en démontrant une connaissance des besoins des clients, de la tarification et de la concurrence; communique efficacement les stratégies de tarification et de services; saisit de manière proactive d’autres occasions commerciales pour Waste Management, en effectuant des références en interne, suivant les besoins.<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Utiliser efficacement les outils logiciels de productivité des ventes de Waste Management (c.-à-d., Base de données des clients et des clients potentiels, programme d’offres, outils de tarification, etc.).<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Proposer des solutions conformes aux réglementations locales, provinciales et fédérales appropriées aux clients.<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Obtention des ressources nécessaires.<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Négociation pour les ventes.<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Analyse des opportunités de ventes.<\u002Fli> \n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Qualifications<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p>Les exigences énumérées ci-dessous représentent les qualifications nécessaires pour occuper le poste.<\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Éducation et expérience<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li>Requis : Baccalauréat ou 5 ans d’expérience en vente au lieu d'un baccalauréat, plus 3 ans en vente B2B et en prospection auprès des entreprises permettant d’obtenir avec succès des rendez-vous avec des clients<\u002Fli> \n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>De préférence : Baccalauréat en ventes\u002Fmarketing plus cinq ans d’expérience des ventes B2B<\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Autres connaissances, compétences ou aptitudes requises<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p>Capacité à convertir les demandes d’annulation des clients afin de maintenir les niveaux de revenus et\u002Fou les compétences de négociation complexes requises. Les compétences générales comprennent :<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Compréhension complète du secteur de la construction (phases, matériaux, déchets, etc.).<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Techniques permettant d’identifier et de gérer de nouvelles opportunités d’affaires.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Techniques permettant d’identifier les objections et d’y répondre.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Techniques permettant de contourner les contrôleurs d’accès.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Compréhension de la concurrence dans la région.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Analyser les problèmes et parvient à les résoudre.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Effectuer des présentations formelles<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Être capable de concevoir des solutions personnalisées qui permettent de résoudre plus que simplement des problèmes de gestion des déchets.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Excellentes compétences commerciales et de communication.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Compréhension des méthodes de calcul de tarification.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Logiciels de base et applications Web.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Apprentissage actif.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Dispositions commerciales.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Motivation appropriée.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Durabilité.<\u002Fli> \n  <li><b>Bilinguisme<\u002Fb><\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <i>IV. <p>Employeur offrant l’égalité d’accès à l’emploi<\u002Fp> \n <p><i>Prêt à commencer votre avenir dès aujourd'hui ? <\u002Fi>Cliquez sur Postuler pour rejoindre l'équipe de Waste Management aujourd'hui.<\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>I. Description du poste \n <p>Superviser la flotte d’équipements primaires et secondaires dans la zone assignée et en conformité avec les objectifs de l’entreprise.<\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>II. Tâches et responsabilités essentielles \n <p>Pour réussir dans cette fonction, un individu doit être en mesure d’accomplir chaque tâche essentielle de manière satisfaisante. D’autres fonctions mineures peuvent lui être confiées.<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Mettre continuellement l’accent sur la rentabilité du marché grâce à une surveillance efficace de la flotte et des activités d’entretien dans la zone assignée, y compris le contrôle des coûts, le perfectionnement des employés et des normes élevées de formation et de sécurité.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Analyser les demandes de biens d’équipement conformément aux directives et aux objectifs de l’entreprise.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Veiller à ce que des véhicules sécuritaires et fiables soient disponibles pour répondre aux besoins opérationnels.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Surveiller l’utilisation efficace de la flotte de véhicules.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Procéder à des examens de la flotte pour s’assurer que les normes d’entretien sont respectées.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>S’assurer que les ateliers d’entretien sont dotés de personnels suffisants et que les mécaniciens sont correctement formés.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>S’assurer que les systèmes de gestion des véhicules sont utilisés efficacement.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Respecter et assurer le respect des normes et règlements de la <i>mission à zéro<\u002Fi> de Waste Management, afin d’encourager des opérations sécuritaires et efficaces.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Respecter toutes les dates d’examen financier et les programmes de l’entreprise en temps opportun.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Veiller à la propreté et à l’entretien des ateliers d’entretien par des inspections régulières et des programmes d’entretien préventif.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Gérer les besoins en personnel de service, y compris la sélection, l’encadrement, la discipline et la formation des employés, ainsi que l’évaluation du rendement des employés.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Fournir des informations sur les décisions de licenciement, de rémunération et de promotion.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Diriger ou assister et contribuer à des rencontres régulières sur la sécurité des chauffeurs, afin de maintenir des relations de travail favorables entre tous les employés et encourager un moral, une productivité et une efficacité maximum.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Donner des formations et des présentations selon les besoins, de manière positive et professionnelle.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Mettre à jour et soumettre les rapports requis en temps opportun.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>III. Tâches de supervision<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Le plus haut niveau de compétences en matière de techniques d’encadrement requis dans cet emploi est la gestion des employés de supervision. Cela comprend :<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Supervision directe de salariés à temps plein, y compris : 8 mécaniciens, 1 soudeur et 1 adjoint administratif<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <p><\u002Fp>IV. Qualifications \n <p>Les exigences énumérées ci-dessous représentent les qualifications nécessaires pour occuper le poste.<\u002Fp> A. Études et expérience \n <ul>\n  <li>Études : diplôme universitaire de deux (2) ou trois (3) ans dans un domaine d’études connexe, ou en lieu et place d’un diplôme, un diplôme d’études secondaires ou une équivalence d’études secondaires et deux (2) ans d’expérience professionnelle.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Expérience : deux (2) ans d’expérience préalable (en plus des exigences en matière d’éducation).<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Toute expérience pertinente peut se substituer aux exigences en matière de formation.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> B. Certificats, licences, inscriptions ou autres exigences \n <ul>\n  <li>Permis de conduire valide requis.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Certification PEP souhaitée.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <p>C. Autres connaissances, compétences ou aptitudes requises<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Expérience comme mécanicien d’équipement lourd.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <p><\u002Fp>V. Environnement de travail \n <p>Vous trouverez ci-dessous les éléments principaux concernant les exigences environnementales et l’environnement de travail de l’emploi. Des accommodements raisonnables peuvent être faits pour permettre aux personnes handicapées d’exercer les fonctions essentielles de l’emploi.<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Nécessité d’utiliser la coordination motrice avec la dextérité des doigts (comme la saisie au clavier, le maniement de machines, etc.) pratiquement tout au long de la journée de travail.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Requiert, dans de rares cas, un effort physique pour la manipulation d’objets de moins de 30 lb.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Requiert, dans de rares cas, d’être exposé à des risques physiques professionnels (tels que coupures, brûlures, exposition à des produits chimiques toxiques, etc.).<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Requiert, à l’occasion, d’être exposé à un environnement physique impliquant la saleté, les odeurs, le bruit, les températures extrêmes ou autres éléments similaires.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>L’environnement normal de ce poste se trouve dans : les bureaux de l’entreprise.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n Job Summary<\u002Fb><br> The Driver Container safely operates a heavy-duty crane mounted truck and is responsible for loading, and transporting material containers to\u002Ffrom customer locations. Drivers will navigate driveways, alleyways, lots, high traffic roadways and may operate in tight overhead environments. Highly skilled backing maneuvers are essential, to successfully perform this job.<br> <br> <b>II. organiser et superviser le travail quotidien d’une équipe de chauffeurs. Nos gestionnaires de routes commerciales supervisent quotidiennement les itinéraires de collecte et les performances des chauffeurs \u002F ouvriers dans plusieurs secteurs d'activité, notamment: Résidentiel, Commercial, Roll-Off et Bagster. Ils développent, implantent et mets à jour des procédures de travail à des fins de standardisation.<\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Tâches et responsabilités :<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Voir au bon fonctionnement et à la résolution de problèmes concernant la gestion quotidienne des opérations de transports et de collecte de la compagnie. (Respect des délais)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Planifie, distribue, surveille et suit les affectations quotidiennes des itinéraires afin de veiller à ce que les clients soient desservis conformément aux contrats.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Gère le processus d’enregistrement en fin de journée<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Transmet aux différents départements concernés les principaux problèmes liés aux services, à la sécurité et à l’équipement qui lui sont rapportés.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Examine la demande \u002F volume hebdomadaire pour les itinéraires, détermine les gains potentiels du réacheminement et recommande les réacheminements aux spécialistes des opérations<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Définit et surveille les objectifs de productivité, de service et de sécurité pour chaque itinéraire et conducteur.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Aide à la collecte de données et à la production de rapports nécessaires de rendement des routes.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Communique et assure le suivi des opportunités de vente, des problèmes survenus chez les clients, des réparations à effectuer, des échanges de conteneurs et des problèmes de sécurité signalés par les chauffeurs.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>S'assure que tout service manqué soit signalé et reporté dans les meilleurs délais.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Évalue et forme le personnel sous sa responsabilité<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Analyse certains sujets : rassembler des données, détecter les problèmes, définir l’ampleur des problèmes, présenter et expliquer les défis et proposer des solutions pour les résoudre<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Gérer les escalades et de multiples projets simultanés pour accroître directeur de district.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Utiliser des outils informatiques pour accomplir différentes tâches, telles que l’approvisionnement, les heures de travail et l’assiduité, les incidents liés à prime au rendement.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Participer à la gestion des situations du type « transporter ou appeler », des collectes spéciales ou des autres affectations d’itinéraires. <\u002Fli>\n age, national origin, disability, or veteran status.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>I. Job Summary<\u002Fb><br> As the <b>WM Way Coach<\u002Fb>, you will work with site leadership to train Operation, Fleet and Dispatch Leaders as well as other Department groups to align business solutions with the company’s strategies and initiatives and have a background in Leadership, Training, or Business Process Optimization (BPO).<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>II. Essential Duties and Responsibilities<\u002Fb><br> To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Other minor duties may be assigned. <\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Works with management, and individual team leaders by contributing strategic vison and integrating a broad range of ideas regarding business solutions development.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Contributes high level expertise in business processes and systems analysis while considering the business implications to the current and future business environment.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Responsible for deliverables, cost, schedule, and quality of one or more enterprise solutions projects.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Works with internal and external customers, suppliers, and other partners to resolve problems, respond to suggestions for improvement and enhancements, test, refine and institutionalize solutions.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Drives the project(s) and the organization toward achieving business results.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>May act as a source of direction, training and guidance for less experienced staff demonstrating coaching, mentoring, and leadership skills<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>III. Supervisory Responsibilities<\u002Fb><br> The highest level of supervisory skills required in this job is the management of supervisory employees. This includes:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>This job has no direct reports but may occasionally be responsible for delegating assignments and tasks on a project basis. Also, may be assigned coaching\u002Fmentoring tasks to help develop less experienced team members.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>IV. Qualifications<\u002Fb><br> The requirements listed below are representative of the qualifications necessary to perform the job.<br> <br> A. Education and Experience<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Education: Bachelor's Degree (accredited), or in lieu of degree, High School Diploma or GED (accredited) and four (4) years of relevant work experience.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience: Five (5) years of relevant work experience (in addition to education requirement).<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p>B. Certificates, Licenses, Registrations or Other Requirements<\u002Fp> \n <p>Core Competencies Required:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li><b>Aligning Performance for Success<\u002Fb> – Focusing and guiding others in accomplishing work objectives.<\u002Fli> \n  <li><b>Building Partnerships<\u002Fb> – Identifying opportunities and taking action to build strategic relationships between teams, departments, units, or organizations to help achieve business goals.<\u002Fli> \n  <li><b>Building Trust <\u002Fb>– Interacting with others in a way that give them confidence in one’s intentions and those of the organization.<\u002Fli> \n  <li><b>Coaching and Developing Others <\u002Fb>– Providing feedback, instruction, and development guidance to help others excel in their current or future job responsibilities; planning and supporting the development of individual skills and abilities.<\u002Fli> \n  <li><b>Decision Making<\u002Fb> – Identifying and understanding issues, problems, and opportunities; comparing data from different sources to draw conclusions; using effective approaches for choosing a course of action or developing appropriate solutions; taking action that is consistent with available facts, constraints, and probable consequences.<\u002Fli> \n  <li><b>Facilitating Change<\u002Fb> – Encouraging others to seek opportunities for different and innovative approaches to addressing problems and opportunities, facilitating the implementation and acceptance of change within the workplace.<\u002Fli> \n  <li><b>High-Impact Communication<\u002Fb> – Clearly and succinctly conveying information and ideas to individuals and groups in a variety of situations; communicating in a focused and compelling way that drives others’ thoughts and actions.<\u002Fli> \n  <li><b>Influence<\u002Fb> – Having a positive impact on others (senior leaders, peers, &amp; front-line personnel), to persuade or convince them to gain their support. Persuasive and engaging, to the point of building buy-in from key stakeholders.<\u002Fli> \n  <li><b>Demonstrates Self Awareness<\u002Fb> – Demonstrates awareness, accurate assessment and control of one's own emotional state, attitudes, beliefs system, image, and strengths in a way to maintain momentum, personal effectiveness, and emotional stability, even in the face of adversity, provocation, stress and\u002For high workload.<\u002Fli> \n  <li><b>Dealing with Ambiguity<\u002Fb> – Can effectively cope with change; can shift gears comfortably; can decide and act without having the total picture; can comfortably handle risk and uncertainty. Accepts change in job requirements, schedules, or work environments as part of job. Adaptable with the unknown.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p>C. Étendue de contrôle: 1 emplacement et de plus de 100 actifs.<\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>II. Fonctions et responsabilités essentielles<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Pour effectuer ce travail avec succès, une personne doit être en mesure d'accomplir chaque tâche essentielle de manière satisfaisante. D'autres tâches mineures peuvent être assignées.<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Se concentre en permanence sur la rentabilité du marché grâce à une gestion efficace de toutes les activités de flotte et de maintenance dans la zone assignée, y compris le contrôle des coûts, le développement des employés et des normes élevées de formation et de sécurité.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Examine les demandes d'équipement en immobilisation conformément aux lignes directrices et aux objectifs de l'entreprise.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Garantit que des véhicules sûrs et fiables sont disponibles pour répondre aux exigences opérationnelles.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Gère l'utilisation efficace des actifs des véhicules.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Effectue des évaluations de flotte pour s'assurer que les normes d'entretien sont respectées.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>S'assure que les ateliers de maintenance disposent d'un personnel adéquat et que les mécaniciens sont correctement formés.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>S'assure que les systèmes de gestion des véhicules sont utilisés efficacement.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Se conforme et garantit le respect des normes et réglementations de la mission Zero Waste Management pour encourager des opérations sûres et efficaces.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Respecte toutes les dates d'examen financier et les programmes dirigés par l'entreprise en temps opportun.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Aide au processus budgétaire au besoin.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Assure la propreté et l'entretien des ateliers de maintenance par des inspections régulières et des programmes de maintenance préventive.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Supervise les besoins en personnel du département, y compris la sélection, l'encadrement, la discipline et la formation des employés et l'évaluation du rendement des employés.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Contribution aux décisions de licenciement, de rémunération et de promotion.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Conduis et\u002Fou assiste et contribue aux réunions périodiques conductrices \u002F sécurité pour maintenir des relations de travail favorables entre tous les employés et promouvoir un moral, une productivité et une efficacité maximale.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Fournit une formation et des présentations au besoin de manière positive et professionnelle.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Met à jour et soumet les rapports requis en temps opportun.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <b>III. Ceci comprend:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Supervision directe des employés à temps plein, y compris de la supervision indirecte des employés à temps plein : 8 mécaniciens, 2 soudeurs, 1 superviseur et 1 adjoint administratif.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>IV.
